alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Scattered thunderstorms will continue to affect Lake Superior tonight. These thunderstorms may produce wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and up to 2 cm hail.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Take cover immediately, if threatening weather approaches. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall watch ended
alerts.description:
Squalls are no longer expected over the area.


###

alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Icy conditions possible Tuesday.

What:
Icy and slippery surfaces.
Risk of freezing rain.

When:
Tuesday.

Additional information:
A low pressure system will continue to bring rain to the area tonight. Rain will change to ice pellets or freezing rain and then snow Tuesday morning as the temperature falls below zero. 

Surfaces may become icy and slippery due to standing water freezing and any freezing rain that falls.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, heavy at times is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

What:
Rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm.

When:
Ending overnight.

Additional information:
A low pressure system will continue to bring heavy rain and thunderstorms to the area.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Don't approach washouts near rivers, creeks and culverts. Keep children and pets away from creeks and river banks.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:

What:

When:
Continuing through early Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
A low pressure system will continue to bring heavy rain and thunderstorms to the area.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning ended
alerts.description:
Significant rainfall is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
A line of thunderstorms is expected to move into northern Lake Huron early this morning. These thunderstorms could produce wind gusts up to 40 knots and frequent lightning.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway.

Surfaces may become icy and slippery due to standing water freezing and any freezing rain that falls.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

Additional information:

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

Surfaces may become icy and slippery due to standing water freezing and any freezing rain that falls.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
